wikipedia_page.main: Albert John Franks (13 April 1936 – 18 June 2017) was an English footballer who played as a wing half. He played in the Football League for Newcastle United and Lincoln City in the Scottish Football League for Rangers, Greenock Morton and Queen of the South, and was player-manager of Scarborough.

response: *18 June: Albert Franks, 81, Rangers, Morton and Queen of the South wing half.
